title: nejiri_hachimaki
body:
A type of [[hachimaki]] made of twisted cloth that is then tied around the head.

Commonly worn in ceremonies and festivals, such as the [[mizu happi]] worn by yamakasa carriers or [[taiko drum|taiko]] drummers. Chefs can also wear this type of hachimaki, but less often than their flatter counterparts.

Nejiri hachimaki implies [[hachimaki]], which itself implies [[headband]], which requires it to [b]cover the forehead[/b].

h6.Correct examples
* !post #6624392
* !post #5455347
* !post #6270132

h6.Incorrect examples
* !post #6651945: Does not cover her forehead

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: toy_hammer_kirby

title: the_book_of_life
body:
From producer Guillermo del Toro and director Jorge Gutierrez comes an animated comedy with a unique visual style. THE BOOK OF LIFE is the journey of Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart.

Before choosing which path to follow, he embarks on an incredible adventure that spans three fantastical worlds where he must face his greatest fears. Rich with a fresh take on pop music favorites, THE BOOK OF LIFE encourages us to celebrate the past while looking forward to the future.
other_names: ブック・オブ・ライフ
ブック・オブ・ライフ〜マノロの数奇な冒険〜

title: drill_kirby
body: A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]] and [[Kirby's Dream Buffet]] which lets [[Kirby]] drill into the ground. When in this form, Kirby wear a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[two-tone headwear|and]] [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[hard hat]] with a [[drill]] in its center and a clear [[visor]]. Evolved Forms * [[Pencil Drill Kirby]] * [[Twin Drill Kirby]]

title: rakkun_sutaru
body:
A magical [[raccoon girl|raccoon/tanuki]] hybrid [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]] [[virtual YouTuber]] and former member of [[Owozu]].

h4. Appearance

She has [[raccoon ears]] and a [[raccoon tail]]. Her eyes are red. She also has a [[two-tone hair]] of [[short hair|short length]], whose colors are mainly [[brown hair|brown]], with [[red hair|red]] [[colored tips|tips]] and a frontal [[streaked hair|streak]]. She often wears a [[raccoon hat]], a [[bandaid on nose|nose bandaid]] and [[domino mask]]. 

As part of her redebut in Owozu, her eyes are [[multicolored eyes|multicolored]] with [[red eyes|red]] and [[blue eyes|blue]], and is sometimes depicted with red [[colored inner hair]].

h4. Costumes

As an indie, her original costume consists of a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[blue jacket]], worn over a [[white camisole]] and a [[black bra]], as well as [[black pants|black]] [[capri pants]] fastened with a [[fur-trimmed_belt |"tail belt"]]. She also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]].

Under Owozu, her second costume (post #5448303) consists of a [s][[beige jacket|beige]][/s] and [[brown jacket]], worn over a [[white camisole]], a black underbust and [[black shorts|black]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[short shorts]]. She also wears [[brown thighhighs]], [[black gloves]] and [[multicolored footwear|multicolored]] [[black footwear|black]] and [[green footwear|green]] [[platform footwear|platform shoes]].

Her third costume (post #7230708) consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[cropped shirt]] accompanied by [[plaid arm warmers|plaid]] [[red arm warmers]] and a [[single bridal gauntlet|single]] [[fishnet bridal gauntlets|fishnet bridal gauntlet]]. Her bottomwear is composed of a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt]], fastened with a [[black belt]]. Her legwear is [[uneven legwear|uneven]] with a [[fishnet socks|fishnet]] [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]] held by a [[thigh strap]] and [[single garter strap|garter strap]]; a [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet]] [[single over-kneehigh|over-kneehigh]], and [[black footwear]].

h4. External Links
* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/c/RakunVT] (main)
* "Twitch":[https://www.twitch.tv/rakkunvt]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Raakkun]
* "Virtual YouTuber Wiki":[https://virtualyoutuber.fandom.com/wiki/Rakkun_Sutaru]

title: bokjumeoni
body:
A bokjumeoni or 복주머니 is a colourful traditional Korean silk [[pouch]] that is carried with a [[hanbok]] due to the latter's lack of pockets. It is believed to bring the holder good luck as suggested by its name which means 'Luck pockets/pouch'.

Nowadays the pouch is used as a gift bag to give small presents such as candy or money.

title: eileennoir
body:
Eileennoir is a Thai [[Indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber]]. She is also a GL comic artist, and a former member of [[Algorhythm Project]] (being suspended on 22 April 2024, and then resigning on 11 May 2024).

Eileennoir is a nephilim, a combination between an [[angel]] and a [[demon]] with an appearance with [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her costume is composed of a [[white dress|white]] [[multicolored dress|and]] [[purple dress|purple]] [[sleeveless]] dress with a pair of [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]], a [[cleavage cutout]] showing her [[large breasts|ample]] [[cleavage|bosom]], a pair of [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[white pantyhose|white]] and [[purple pantyhose]] and a pair of [[yellow footwear|golden]] [[high heels]]. She also wears [[purple nails|purple]] [[nail polish|nails]], two pairs of [[purple wings]], a [[white belt]] on her [[thigh belt|left thigh]], a [[purple collar|purple]] and [[white collar]] with a [[purple bowtie]], a pair of bowtie-shaped [[earrings]] and a large [[halo]] behind her head. 

She has two cats, a [[black cat|black]] one named [[Mocha (eileennoir)|]] and the [[brown cat|brown]] one called [[Latte (eileennoir)|]]. 
She later revealed that she has a girlfriend called [[Khun Mha (eileennoir)|]] (Thai: คุณหม๋า, Literal meaning: Ms Doog) who is a [[dog girl]].

title: yamamura_hiroki
body:
This artist is a professional animator who worked closely with studio [[Shaft (company)|]] on series such as [[Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei]], [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]], and the [[monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]] mostly as chief animation director.

Prior to that (under the pen-name "Murayama Takahiro") he was the illustrator of ero-games such as [[Usaneko]] and [[GHQ: Chihiro Gakuen Ura Gakuensai]] from about 2003 - 2007.

Before that, he was a doujin artist with the same pen-name styling himself as ""Studio Pakli":[https://kabe-uchiroom.com/mypage/?id=185655283]" and published a few doujinshi with [[Suzuki Amaharu]] in the "Jibaku System" circle and others from about 1999-2003.

title: ibuki_meno
body:
An [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[Virtual Youtuber]], and former 1st batch member of [[Prism Project]]. She's a mecha [[dragon girl]]. She wears a silver metallic coat with a circuit board pattern on it. On her neck, there is a small black bowtie. She wears a short grey skirt that is fastened with a grey belt. She also wears white tights and black boots. Her belly button is exposed. On her back, she has a large metallic tail, that she can detach at any moment. She has dark purple eyes with electronic accents on them. She has very long grey hair that reaches below the knees. On top of her head, she has a pair of light blue holographic horns.

Her voice is very soft and quiet and is very shy, and won't speak during collabs unless she needs to. 

She often refers to herself in third-person, calls her fans "Otagons" and her catchphrase is "Ippui!"

Her character designer is [[siragagaga]].

h4. External links

* "Youtube":https://www.youtube.com/MenoIbuki
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/IbukiMeno

title: chou_eshi_ten_~if_no_gakkyoku_sekai_ten~
body:
An annual exhibition managed by [[Niconico]] under its [[Niconico Chokaigi]] artist platform that runs during the last full week of April. Its theme is "what would the world look like if the artists were different?", where artists are given a list of themes by [[VOCALOID]] producers based on their songs and must reinterpret them in their own styles.

It features approximately a hundred artists, with four artists each drawing one of the 25 songs available.

h4. External links

title: shadow_(kingdom_hearts)
body: Iconic [[Heartless (kingdom hearts)|]] seen in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series. They appear humanoid but have [[black skin]], beady [[yellow eyes]] and [[antennae]].

title: nobody_(kingdom_hearts)
body:
Main monster enemies in [[Kingdom Hearts II]], resulting from when a strong-willed person loses their heart and is split between their [[Heartless (kingdom hearts)|]] and the remnants of their body and soul. When that person's Heartless and Nobody are defeated, they return to their original selves.

[[Organization XIII]] is a group of thirteen powerful Nobodies who have control over a specific class of lesser Nobodies, generally based upon their weapon and/or specific element. For example, [[axel (kingdom hearts)|Axel]] can use Assassins, while [[Xigbar]] controls Snipers.

title: heartless_emblem
body: Identifying motif of the Emblem [[Heartless (kingdom hearts)|]] in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] JRPG series.  A black Valentine-style heart with an inverted fleur-de-lis at bottom, outlined in red with a barbed "X" across the middle. Typically located in the center of the chest/body or head.

title: ansem_seeker_of_darkness
body:
[[Kingdom Hearts]] character. Refers to a character who is mentioned throughout [[Kingdom Hearts I]] as a wise man who compiled a series of reports detailing how to defeat the [[Heartless (kingdom hearts)|]].

[spoiler]He winds up being the main antagonist of the first game by possessing [[Riku (kingdom hearts)|]]'s body and seeking to open the door to the Realm of Darkness. In [[Kingdom Hearts II]], he is revealed to be [[Master Xehanort]]'s Heartless, and returns in [[kingdom hearts 3d dream drop distance|Dream Drop Distance]] despite his earlier defeat.[/spoiler]

Not to be confused for [[Ansem the Wise]].

title: heartless_(kingdom_hearts)
body:
Recurring antagonistic entities from the [[KINGDOM HEARTS]] JRPG series. They are divided into Purebloods (coalesced darkness) and Emblem Heartless (formed from hearts), with shared and unique visual traits between the two.

h6. Shared Traits

* dark exteriors/"skin"
* simple, [[yellow eyes]]
* jagged mouths
* bent, spiral features
* monstrous appearances

h6. "Pureblood" Traits

* mostly dark
* may have a heart-shaped hole
* either weak- or strong-looking

h6. "Emblem" Traits

* colorful
* [[heartless_emblem|heart-shaped]] symbol on body
* themed ([[Soldier]]s, elemental mages, etc.)

[[Ansem Seeker of Darkness]] is an Emblem Heartless that retained a human form and mind.

If a Heartless is created from a strong-willed person, the discarded body and mind becomes a [[nobody (kingdom hearts)|Nobody]].

title: harpsichord
body:
The harpsichord is a keyboard instrument. Whereas the piano produces sound by striking a set of strings, the harpsichord produces sound by plucking the strings. 

The frame of a harpsichord is often more angular than that of a {{grand_piano|grand piano}}. Some harpsichords have more than one keyboard (such as the instrument in post #4870510).

title: leila_malcal
body:
The female lead of [[Code Geass]] spin-off [[Code Geass: Boukoku no Akito]].

Leila comes from a family of former Britannian aristocrats and she is a military officer in the E.U. Army. She works under Gene Smilas and is [[Hyuuga Akito]]'s superior and the Commander of the W-0 Unit comprised of Japanese teenagers who recklessly plunge into a battlefield where the survival rate is extremely low. They fight for their freedom, so that they can have a country that they can return to that feels like “home”. Thus begins their fight against the adult world. She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]] and pilots a custom [[Alexander (code geass)|Alexander Type-02]].

[spoilers]A young Leila contracted with [[C.C.]] and developed a [[geass]]. However, since Leila doesn't use her geass a lot, and thus the geass is "dormant", it makes her left eye instead have a [[blue eyes|bluish color]].[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Sakamoto Maaya]].

h4. External links

* "Code Geass Wiki: Leila Malcal":[https://codegeass.fandom.com/wiki/Leila_Malcal]

title: project_upd8
body:
activ8's virtual talent support 'group', supporting independently-affiliated Virtual Talent in exchange for a portion of their earnings.

Spearheaded by [[Kizuna Ai]], with folks even joining squarely because of her, until April 2020, when she was spun-off into her own autonomous subsidiary.

After two years since beginning in June 2018, it was announced, on November 1st, 2020, that the project would disband on December 31st, 2020.

Due to upd8's nature as merely a support group, and not an actual company, much of the talent associated with upd8 just handled themselves, if not by different companies.

h4. Talent that was at some point part of upd8 in rough chronological order 
[tn]Departures/retirements listed if they occurred under upd8. Groups and channels with multiple characters receive their own copytag.[/tn]
* [[Osanai Mei]]
* [[Omega Ray]] and [[Omega Rio]] / [[Omega Sisters]]
* [[Kizuna Ai]] (departed in April 2020)
* Hanamure Chinaki, [[Sorae (tenmoku doushin project)|]], Tsunowane Akagi and Toritoi // [[Tenmoku Doushin Project]]
* [[Yuen Aya]] and [[Yuen Mina]] / [[AyaMina Games]] (retired in December 2018)
* [[YuNi (yuni channel)|]] / [[YuNi Channel]] (departed in August 2020 for TOY'S FACTORY)
* [[Oda Nobuhime]] (retired in April 2020)
* [[Cafe no Zombi-ko]] (retired in March 2020)
* [[Nijikawa Laki]]
* [[Kashiko Mari]]
* [[Hibiki Ao]]

title: yuria_(eversoul)
body:
Deuteragonist and currently an unobtainable character from [[Eversoul]], belonging to the [spoiler]Angel[/spoiler] faction.

As Queen of the Kingdom of Solrey, she is one half of the duo that summoned [[savior_(eversoul)|The Savior]] to their time in order to help the Souls fight against a looming threat endangering their world of Eden, alongside [[mephistopheles_(eversoul)|Mephistopheles]]. Due to said summoning, she has lost almost all her power, rendering her unable to participate in actual battles herself. [spoiler]Main Story Chapter 5 reveals her true identity as the Soul "Apollyon", who was said to have brought the apocalypse that humanity tried to run away from after they summoned her.[/spoiler]

Likes doting on Mephi and eating spicy foods.

Her associated artifact is [b]The Fifth Trumpet[/b].

h3. Appearance:
[tn]See post #6002625.[/tn]
She is a beautiful Soul with [[curly hair|curly]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She is usually seen with a golden [[headdress]] that acts as her crown. Her costume follows the same color scheme as the Savior and Mephistopheles, with a primarily [[white dress|white]] [[turtleneck]] [[sleeveless]] dress with some golden adornments. She also wears [[white gloves|white]] [[bridal gauntlet|bridal gauntlets]] and golden footwear.

title: mephistopheles_(eversoul)
body:
Tritagonist and an obtainable character from [[Eversoul]], belonging to the Humanlike faction.

Nicknamed "Mephi", she is an artificial Soul created by a scientist named Dr. Faust to pilot one of the nine arks to be used in escaping Earth during an apocalyptic event in the late 24th century. Centuries later, after making a critical mistake that led to the mass death of the humans aboard, the ark made its way back to Earth, which has been recovering with the help of the Souls that remained. She is one half of the duo that summoned [[savior_(eversoul)|The Savior]] to Eden to help them in their crisis, alongside [[yuria_(eversoul)|Queen Yuria]].

Her artifact is [b]Ark Metatron[/b], her own operated Ark to transport the humanity to space prior to the initial apocalypse.

h3. Costumes:
* Ark Operator (default)
* [[mephistopheles_(fluttering_pink_jelly)_(eversoul)|Fluttering Pink Jelly]] (Love Story True Ending costume)
* Comfy School Life ("Everschool!" Limited-time costume)

h3. Appearance:
[tn]See posts: post #5860306 and post #5974250.[/tn]
She is a [[white hair|white-haired]], [[blue eyes|blue-eyed]] girl. Floating above her head is something akin to a [[broken halo]]. She also sports [[low-tied long hair]]. Her clothing follows a similar color scheme as the Savior and Yuria, wearing a primarily [[white dress|white]] [[turtleneck]] dress with [[shoulder cutout|shoulder cutouts]]. Her [[frilled sleeves]] [[sleeves past fingers|go past her fingers]]. Her [[bare legs]] have [[thigh strap|thigh straps]], and since she usually moves around by floating in the air, she is usually seen [[barefoot]].

title: tokugawa_ieyasu
body:
(January 31, 1543 – June 1, 1616)
Historical figure. Born as Matsudaira Takechiyo.

Raised as the political hostage of [[Imagawa Yoshimoto]], he broke off relations after Yoshimoto's death in Okehazama. Renamed himself to Matsudaira Motonobu, then Matsudaira Motoyasu, then assumed the Tokugawa Ieyasu name in 1567.
Co-led the Oda-Tokugawa army in the Battle of Anegawa against the Azai-Asakura army alongside [[Oda Nobunaga]].

Later fought against [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi]] at Komaki and Nagakute (outskirts of [[Nagoya (city)|]]) in 1584 before making peace with Hideyoshi.

After Hideyoshi's death, he led the Eastern Army in the Battle of Sekigahara against the (pro-Toyotomi) Western Army led by [[Ishida Mitsunari]] in 1600.

Became shogun in 1603, and founded the Tokugawa Shogunate which ruled Japan until 1868. This time period is known as the [[Edo Jidai]].

Fictional depictions of Ishida Mitsunari are tagged separately.

h4. See also
* [[Miyamoto Musashi]] - occasionally depicted as Ieyasu's right hand man, though they seems to have no historical relations in real life

title: akizuki_ryo
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the DS game [[Idolmaster Dearly Stars]].

Soft-spoken 15-year-old Ryou is an idol from 876 Productions and cousin of 765 Production's intern-turned-idol, [[Akizuki Ritsuko]]. Ryou is actually a [[otoko_no_ko|boy]]; who, fed up with his lack of a love life and unwanted attention from boys, asked Ritsuko to help turn him into a cool male idol. She then introduced him to [i]876[/i], only to be dressed up as a girl in a desperate attempt to save a show whose actual performer never showed up in time. He becomes part of the unit [[Dearly Stars (idolmaster)|]] for a time.

He appears in [[Idolmaster Side-M]], where he has changed representation from 876 to 315 Productions and now works openly as a male idol, joining the unit [[F-LAGS_(idolmaster)|]]. He is also the only [i]boy[/i], let alone a [[crossdressing]] one, to make appearances in [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]].

Ryou's theme color is mint green, and he is voiced by [[Sanpei Yuuko]]. 

h4. External links

* "Project iM@S Wiki: Ryo Akizuki":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Ryo_Akizuki

title: yamato_aki
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Aki is an upbeat woman who loves everything military related: from the smallest combat knives to the largest naval warships. She has a massive collection of airsoft and replica guns, including several out of production airsoft weapons. Aki is very knowledgeable in the topics of wilderness survival and military tactics, and is also a crack shot with airsoft guns. She cares very deeply about military hardware and military history. title: wakabayashi_tomoka
body:
A 17 year old girl from [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]] in the Passion (Yellow Sun) category.  Sports a long brown ponytail and brown eyes.

Tomoka is a cheerful cheerleader who enjoys lifting other people's spirits. She is as energetic as one might imagine, and she's always full of cheer. She enjoys being a source of happiness and believes it to be a truly special power that she has.

title: umeki_otoha
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Otoha is the daughter of classical musicians, and considers music to be her foundation and purpose in life. She is very serious when it comes to music, tone, harmony, and pitch. While Otoha considers the Producer to be her muse, she actually dislikes a lot of things about being an idol. She is only one because it makes the Producer happy and is the bond that connects them. Otoha also loves nature. She seems to be friends with [[Sakurai Momoka]] due to them both having similar demeanors. 


* Age: 19
* Height: 172 cm
* Weight: 49 kg
* Birthday: June 20
* Blood type: AB
* Three sizes: 86-58-85
* Hobbies: Walking in the Woods, Piano
* Writing Hand: Right
* Horoscope: Gemini
* Hometown: Hokkaido

title: ujiie_mutsumi
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. She is 13 and likes books and movies in the adventure genre.

Mutsumi is a soft-spoken girl who wants to live a true adventure. She is always eager to discover the excitements of life that she has read about in her books. Some of her more notable reads include Don Quixote and Indiana Jones. While initially rather aloof, Mutsumi gradually lets herself be a bit wilder after she obtains her first Plus form. When in idol form, she switches her side braid for loose hair with curls. She believes it is very important for idols to challenge themselves and she appears to be knowledgeable in the subjects of Japan’s history.



* Age: 13
* Height: 152 cm
* Weight: 42 kg
* Birthday: July 13
* Blood type: AB
* Three sizes: 78-57-80
* Hobbies: Reading adventure novels, watching adventure movies
* Writing Hand: Right

* Hometown: Tochigi

body:
A cufflink (also cuff link or cuff-link) is a decorative fastener worn by men or women to fasten the two sides of the [[sleeve_cuffs|cuff]] on the sleeve of a [[dress shirt]] or [[blouse]].
Cufflinks are designed only for use with shirts which have buttonholes on both sides but no buttons.

title: enema
body:
Enema, also known as clyster, is a fluid injected into the lower bowel by way of the rectum.

The most frequent use of an enema is to relieve constipation or for bowel cleansing before a medical examination or "procedure".

title: ribbed_leotard
body:
A [[leotard]] that has vertical lines made to resemble a ribbed pattern.

Should note if searching for these in real life they are not actually leotards, but instead called a "bodysuit."  The term referring to a leotard-like garment made from different material worn in replacement of a shirt.  These are different from the full body covering used for the bodysuit tag on Danbooru.

title: barraki_(bionicle)
body: A group of warlords from [[Bionicle]] who attempted to takeover the Matoran Universe. They were banished to a prison known as "The Pit" it for their crimes, and later mutated by the waters of The Pit.

title: great_spirit_robot
body: The massive robot body of [[mata_nui_(toa)_(bionicle)|Mata Nui]] from [[Bionicle]]. It is said to be over 40,000,000 feet tall or 12,192 kilometers high. It is big enough to house entire islands and landmasses inside giant domes.

title: matoro_(bionicle)
body: A former Matroan of Ice who became the Toa Marhi of Ice from [[Bionicle]]. He uses an Ice sword or a pair of claws. He wears the [[kanohi_(bionicle)|Kanohi]] Tryna, the Mask of Reanimation.

title: jaller_(bionicle)
body: A Matoran of Fire from the first years of [[Bionicle]] who became a Toa of Fire. He is the leader of the Toa Mahri. He wields a fire sword and wears the [[kanohi_(bionicle)|Kanohi]] Arthron, the Mask of Sonar.

title: lewa_(bionicle)
body: A Toa of Air and a member of the Toa Nuva from [[Bionicle]]. He uses a green Axe or a pair of air sabers. He wears the [[kanohi_(bionicle)|Kanohi]] Miru, the Mask of Levitation.

title: gali_(bionicle)
body: The Toa Nuva of Water from [[Bionicle]]. She uses a pair of hooks or axes that double as fins. She wears the [[kanohi_(bionicle)|Kanohi]] Kaukau, the Mask of Water Breathing.

title: pohatu_(bionicle)
body: The Toa Nuva of Stone from [[Bionicle]]. He wears the [[kanohi_(bionicle)|Kanohi]] Kakama, the Mask of Speed.

title: kopaka_(bionicle)
body: The deputy of the Toa Nuva and a Toa of Ice from [[Bionicle]]. He uses an ice sword and shield. He wears the [[kanohi_(bionicle)|Kanohi]] Akaku, the Mask of X-Ray Vision.

title: antroz_(bionicle)
body: A member of the Makuta species from [[Bionicle]], prominently featured in its 2008 storyline. He is the field leader of the Makuta sent to take over Karda Nui. He uses the [[kanohi_(bionicle)|Kanohi]] Jutlin, the Mask of Corruption.

title: copyright_request
body:
A request to identify the copyright tag of a post.

Do not use for posts that are most likely [[original]] and don't have a copyright. Only use when you are reasonably sure the post is from a known copyright, but you don't know what it is.

Use [[check copyright]] if you are not sure about the copyright of a post.

h4. See also

* [[artist request]]

title: character_request
body:
A request to identify a character in the post.

Do not use for [[original]] characters that probably don't have a name or character tag. Only use when you are reasonably sure the character is a known character from a known copyright, but you don't know who the character is.

Use [[check character]] to request verification if you are not sure about the character tag.

h4. See also

* [[copyright request]]
* [[cosplay request]]

title: nier:automata
body:
[i]NieR:Automata[/i] is an action role-playing video game developed by Platinum Games and published by [[Square Enix]] for the [[PlayStation 4]], [[Xbox One]], [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Nintendo Switch]]. It is the indirect sequel to both [i]NieR RepliCant[/i] and [i]NieR Gestalt[/i] ([[NieR]]), and is set in the year 11945, during the 14th Machine War.

In February 2022 during the 5th anniversary live stream it was announced that a TV anime was in the works.

h4. See also

* [[List of Nier series characters]]

title: jacket_girl_(dipp)
body: The "Jacket Girl" refers to the unnamed girl featured on the album cover (jacket) of [[Dolls In Pseudo Paradise]]. Officially, very little about her is known beyond her design. Originally, her design is monochrome, but fans have generally interpreted her to have [[blonde hair]] and black [[dress|clothes]]. She has [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy hair]] and wears a [[frilled hat]]. She is often depicted holding a [[cross]]. Some have interpreted her as being the sole woman from the group of Eight Honest Men, who succumbed to insanity and became a youkai, murdering her fellow Honest Men.

title: official_alternate_color
body:
[[Alternate color]]s of official origin. This tag should be used when a significant amount of a character's color palette is different; if only a specific part of a character is a different color, use a different tag instead (for example, if only the hair color is different, use [[official alternate hair color]]).

Characters or beings may change colors to represent an alternate idea for the character, which could include an [[alternate form]]. This can be encountered in different forms such as a skin for a character in a video game or during a character's special action.

[b]Do not[/b] use this tag with [[alternate color]], the tags are mutually exclusive.

h4. Examples:

* [[acheron_(honkai:_star_rail)|Acheron]] from [[Honkai: Star Rail]] has her outfit, hair, eyes and leg tattoo change colour during her ultimate attack.
* [[pyra_(xenoblade)|Pyra]] from [[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]] has an alternate dark color [[Super Smash Bros.]] skin.

h4. See also:

- [[official alternate hair color]]
- [[official alternate eye color]]

title: browning_hi-power
body:
The [b]Browning Hi-Power[/b] is a single-action, semi-automatic [[handgun]], introduced in 1935. Initially designed by [[John Moses Browning|John Browning]] for [[FN Herstal]], and completed by Dieudonné Saive after his death. 
It was the first hand[[gun]] design that features a standard double-stack [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] containing thirteen 9×19mm [[ammunition|rounds]], the origin of "High Power" [[weapon name|naming]] in allusion to the higher capacity.

h4. Related tags:
* [[HP-35 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M1911]]

h4. External links

title: konton_(nijiura_maids)
body:
A Chinese [[Nijiura Maids|Nijiura Maid]], based on the Hundun (混沌) - one of the Si-xiong (Four Fiends) mentioned in Chinese mythology. As such, she is often seen with fellow Si-xiong maids [[Toukotsu (nijiura maids)|]], [[Toutetsu (nijiura maids)|]] and [[Kyuuki_(nijiura_maid)|Kyuuki]].

Konton appears as a small [[furry]] girl with long [[green hair]] that [[hair over eyes|covers her eyes]]. She has an [[ahoge]] and [[sidelocks]] that hang down in a manner similar to dog ears (like [[Inu-T]]'s hairstyle.) Her body is dog-like and covered with grey/light brown fur, but this is usually hidden under her outfit with the exception of her paws, [[dog tail|tail]], and occasional face fur.

Her maid uniform is a white apron over what appears to be a long-sleeved black [[changpao]] with yellow trim.

In mythology, Hundun represents chaos. It is known as a "faceless beast" and portrayed in some interpretations as a dog, which explains why Konton is a dog girl and her eyes are always hidden.



h4. See also

* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hundun Wikipedia article on the Hundun

title: nijiura_maids
body:
The Nijiura Maids are characters of the [[Futaba Channel]] japanese imageboard (specifically Nijiura, as the name suggests.) They are a collection of [[maid]] characters most of whose personalities are based on puns involving their names. The first of these, [[Medoi]]-san's name is a pun on "meido", the japanese pronounciation of the english word "maid". Medoi is slang for "bother", so Medoi-san finds everything to be a bother. Most of the rest follow a similar pattern.

These characters may not fall into the traditional Nijiura Maid template, but they [i]are[/i] maid characters thought up by Nijiura residents and are often seen in conjunction with the other maids. 

* [[Chibi Yami]]
* [[Iya Maid]]

h5. Nijiura Chinese Maids

A set of maids known as the Nijiura Chinese Maids (虹裏中華メイド庫)  They are primarily based on Chinese constellations and mythology. I'm not sure if it merit a separate tag in addition to the basic nijiura maid one, but yeah. We'll probably need to make new tags for those that currently have other unrelated posts on their name's tag, but that can happen later.

Note that in all cases, these character's names are the Japanese equivalent of the Chinese creature they're based on (as opposed to the original Nijiura maids, whose names are often based on word combinations or puns.)

title: blood_devil_(chainsaw_man)
body:
The Blood Devil is a devil that embodies the fear of [[blood]].

It is [[Power (Chainsaw Man)|Power's]] fully powered Devil form. She appears as a tall humanoid with four arms and a mostly white body. Her head has a pointed appearance with a dark color, sharp teeth and two circular eyes with cross-like pupils; she has long ears in this form and long hair. Her chest has an open rib cage showing a chest cavity full of intestines up to her neck. Her arms have dark coloration from hand to elbow. She has three-fingered hands and large claws. Her legs have the same dark coloration from the mid-thigh down, ending in heel-like feet.

title: hina_ningyou
body:
雛人形 (hina-ningyō) are ornamental dolls representing the Emperor, Empress, attendants, and musicians in the traditional court dress of the "Heian period":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heian_period, the [[sokutai]] and [[karaginu mo]]. Displayed before and during the [[Hinamatsuri]] (Japanese Doll Festival, or Girls' Day) held on March 3rd.

Tag refers to both the doll set itself and situations where characters dress up as any of the dolls.

The (typically red) multi-tiered stand where the dolls are set is called [[hinadan]].

[[Hishimochi]], [[hina arare]], [[folding screen]] and [[bonbori_(lighting)|bonbori]] are placed around the dolls.

title: mynah_(signalis)
body:
Replika Type MNHR (Minenarbeit Nukleartechnik Hochsicherheits Replika | Mining NuclearTech High-Security Replica) Mynah.

The [[mynah_(Signalis) | Mynah]] (In reference to the "Myna":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myna) is a character / unit in the game [[Signalis]].

Mynahs act as the mules of the replika forces employed by the Eusan Nation in the game. They are typically used for heavy duty and hazardous tasks. Such as dealing with dangerous cargo, lethal levels of [[radiation]], heavy machinery and so on. 

Standing at 260cm (8'6"), the MNHR is the tallest replika, even outclassing the [[Falke_(Signalis) | Falke]] and by far most durable one in the Eusan arsenal. Hauling heavy [[power_armor | power armor]], a [[energy_cannon | mining laser]], and accompanied by other corrupted Replika, the Mynah is one of the most dangerous units the player may encounter.

[spoilers] A [[corrupted Mynah (signalis)|]] poses as the first boss in the game. Later on, the player will have to face off against more hostile Mynah units and their accompanying Replika. You will also encounter a friendly but damaged Mynah named [[Beo (signalis)|]].[/spoilers]  

[b]Appearance[/b]

On top of the mentioned [[power_armor | power armor]] and the fact that the Mynah is an [[android]], they have [[blue_eyes | blue eyes]] and [[short_hair | short]] [[black_hair | black hair]] and sometimes are depicted with their face plate lowered, covering their face.

title: kolibri_(signalis)
body:
Replika Type KLBR (Kommando-Leiteinheit Bioresonanztechnik-Replika | Commando Control Unit Bioresonance Technology Replica) Kolibri.

The Kolibri is a character / unit in the game [[Signalis]].

Kolibris act as commanders and coordinators, utilizing their bioresonance to influence or read the minds or Replikas/Gestalts and communicate telepathically with other Kolibri units. A cadre of Kolibri units always accompany every [[falke_(signalis)| Falke]] to assist with their commands and leadership.

Ingame, [[corrupted Kolibri (signalis)|]]s are stationary and are incapable of attacking, instead they disorient the player by bombarding them with visuals the closer they are alongside hiding amongst several fake duplicates. Kolibris can either be killed by shooting the real Kolibri or by setting the radio to the correct frequency.

[spoilers] The last uncorrupted Kolibri can be found holed up within the library. [/spoilers]

h6. Appearance
On top of being an [[android]], the Kolibri unit has: [[short hair | short]] [[black hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[forehead mark | three marks]] on their forehead.

title: eule_(signalis)
body:
Replika Type EULR (Einfache Universelle Leichte Replika | Simple Universal Light Replica) Eule.

The Eule (Owl in German) is a character / unit in the game [[Signalis]].

Eules are multi-purpose workers, suited primarily towards domestic tasks such as; cooking, cleaning, medical, or office work. 

Ingame, [[corrupted Eule (signalis)|]]s make up the majority of enemies encountered. Although not very dangerous, they are very rarely ever encountered alone.

Gameplay Spoilers :
[spoiler] The player can find 2 uncorrupted Eules ingame. One holed up inside the nurses office and another within the mines accompanying an injured [[star_(Signalis) | Star]] unit. [/spoiler]

h6. Appearance
On top of being an [[android]], the Eule unit has: [[short hair | short]] [[black hair]], [[blue eyes]], and are often seen wearing a [[garrison cap]].

title: ara_(signalis)
body:
Replika Type ARAR (Allzweck-Reparatur-Arbeiter Replika | All-Purpose Repair Worker Replica) Ara.

The Ara (Macaw in German) is a character / unit in the game [[Signalis]].

Ara units act as general maintenance, production, and construction workers. They have all but replaced Gestalt workers in industrial or production jobs within the Eusan Nation.

Ingame, [[corrupted Ara (signalis)|]] units hide underneath the floor before emerging to ambush the player as they walk past. Slow and weak, their ability to appear in almost any room can easily catch the player off guard.

[spoilers] The last uncorrupted Ara can be found hiding inside a maintenance shaft within the STORCH dormitory. [/spoilers]

h6. Appearance
On top of being an [[android]], the Ara unit has: [[short hair | short]] [[black hair]], [[blue eyes]], and is usually seen wearing a [[hard hat]].

title: corrupted_ara_(signalis)
body:
[[Ara (signalis)|]]s in their [[zombie|corrupted state]]. They hide in vents under the floor in order to ambush [[Elster (signalis)|]].

h6. Appearance
The Ara's corrupted form sports inflated puffy arms and a corroded head, as well as a hunched form where the skin on the back has been degraded to [[exposed muscle|expose the muscles, flesh]], and spinal structure beneath.

title: space_ghost_coast_to_coast

Space Ghost Coast to Coast is an American adult animated comedy late-night talk show created by Mike Lazzo for [[Cartoon Network]] and starring a re-imagined version of the cast of the 1960s Hanna-Barbera cartoon [[Space Ghost (series)|]], hosted by [[Space Ghost]]. It is the first TV show to be produced by Williams Street, the company that would start up [[Adult Swim]] in the early 2000s.

title: chest_stand
body:
A pose where you place your chest on the ground, and curve your back upwards and over until both of your legs are in front of your head.

In Japanese, this is known as the "King Aladdin Impression" (キングアラジンの真似, [i]King Aladdin no Mane[/i]), after King Aladdin, the villain in the first episode of the horror TV drama, "Operation: Mystery!":[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0195480/releaseinfo] (怪奇大作戦, [i]Kaiki Daisakusen[/i]). In the drama, he rolls away in the chest stand position, and laughing, disappears into the wall as though being plastered into it.

The TV series in itself isn't that well known. However, [[Hyoudou Makoto]], one of the characters in Yuuki Masami's [[Kyuukyoku Choujin R]], does "this pose as his speciality":http://mafactory.com/usersvoice/blogs/master/archive/2007/05/05/429.aspx and so the name became popularised as a result.

More recently, this pose has also been called the [i]Gundam Epyon Mobile Armour Mode[/i]. The [[Gundam Epyon]] in the [[Gundam Wing]] is able to transform into what looks like a two-headed [[dragon]]. This design is meant to be breathtaking when seen from above but from below, you can really understand how it just looks as though it's doing a simple chest stand.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Posture]]

title: code_geass
body:
[b]Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion[/b] (コードギアス 反逆のルルーシュ [i]Kōdo Giasu: Hangyaku no Rurūshu[/i], lit. "Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion"), often referred to as simply Code Geass, is a Japanese anime series created by [[sunrise_(company)|Sunrise]], directed by Gorō Taniguchi, and written by Ichirō Ōkouchi, with original character designs by manga authors [[Clamp (circle)|]].

Code Geass first ran in Japan on MBS from October 5, 2006, to July 28, 2007. Its sequel series, [[code geass|Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion R2]] (コードギアス 反逆のルルーシュR2), ran as a simulcast on JNN stations (like MBS and TBS) from April 6, 2008 to September 28, 2008. The series has also been adapted into various manga and light novels with the former showing various alternate scenarios from the TV series. Bandai Entertainment also licensed most parts from the franchise for English release in December 2007, airing the two TV series on Cartoon Network. Most manga and light novels have also been published in North America by Bandai.

Set in an alternate timeline, the series focuses on how the former prince Lelouch vi Britannia obtains a power known as Geass and decides to use it to obliterate the Holy Britannian Empire, an imperial monarchy and a superpower that has been conquering various countries.

title: honneamise_no_tsubasa
body:
[b]Royal Space Force: The Wings of Honnêamise[/b] [i](Ōritsu Uchūgun: Oneamisu no Tsubasa[/i]) is the first feature-length anime movie produced by [[Gainax]]. Released in 1987, it is directed by Yamaga Hiroyuki with assistant director Akai Takami. The music for the anime film was composed by the late famous musician and actor "Sakamoto Ryuichi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryuichi_Sakamoto . [[Sadamoto Yoshiyuki]] designed the characters and [[Anno Hideaki]] worked on it as animation and special effects artist.

The animated film is set in an alternate Earth-like [[alien]] world where an industrial humanoid civilization is flourishing amid an impending war between two bordering nations: the Kingdom of Honneamise and "The Republic". The Kingdom of Honneamise begins the development of an experimental [[space]] program to put the [[astronaut|first man in space]] and thus creates the first [i]Royal Space Force[/i].

This epic [[science fiction]] anime movie would ultimately be a "critically acclaimed Gainax classic":http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/the-wings-of-honneamise-1995 from the 80s, but it was poorly received and sold only modestly domestically and overseas. 

A sequel called [[Aoki Uru]] ([i]"Blue Uru"[/i]) was intended to be released in the 90s, but due to lack of funds, Gainax abandoned it part way through production. This sequel was going to be set in the same universe of the original but 50 years in the future. "However,":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2013-03-20/gainax-makes-blue-uru-film-with-honneamise-yamaga-sadamoto the project has been revived once again.

body:
A Npc character from [[Arknights]]. A nobleman from the Ursus Empire, he adopted [[talulah (arknights)|Talulah]] as his heir after she ran away from Lungmen. 

In truth, [spoilers]Duke Kashchey is the actually antagonist of the Reunion arc and the reason for Reunion's radicalization from a peaceful group fighting for the rights of the Infected to an extremist militant group. After failing to convince Talulah of his Social Darwinist beliefs which led to Talulah killing him, Kashchey tried to possesses Talulah's body, which he succeeded after Talulah suffered several tragic events, including the death of her best friend [[Alina (arknights)|Alina]]. Now in possession of Talulah's body, Kashchey manipulates and radicalize Reunion and it's members as part of his plans to start a war between Ursus and the Yan Empire. Eventually he is defeated and his plans foiled after Rhodes Island learns the truth with [[Amiya (Arknights)|Amiya]] forcing Kashchey out of Talulah's body. Currently Kashchey is possessing a new body under the name [[koshelna (arknights)|Koshelna]].[/spoilers]

title: koshelna_(arknights)
body: A Npc character from [[Arknights]]. A Liberi woman who works as a school teacher in Ursus. [spoilers]Koshelna is actually the newest body of [[duke kashchey (arknights)|Duke Kashchey]] after he was forced out of [[Talulah (Arknights)|Talulah's]] body by [[Amiya (Arknights)|Amiya]].[/spoilers]

title: hishimiya_tsugaru
body:
One of the poster characters for [[Beatmania IIDX]] 8th style, along with [[Daruma_(beatmania)|]].

The young daughter of a wealthy former zaibatsu family, Tsugaru is the student council president at the Tokyo Private Boarding School, the same school Daruma attends.  She's about the same age as [[Xia]] and is said to bear something of a resemblance to her.

Tsugaru's parents have great hopes for her, and she is expected to set the standard for the rest of the students in the school. Due to this situation, she's placed under enormous stress every day. Perhaps as a reaction to this, she's taken around to wandering around town late at night to blow off steam. She has to sneak in to game centers and clubs that enforce age limits on entry. Her cool, professional demeanor from the daytime disappears at night, and she feels free to act more herself. Through IIDX, she was drawn to Daruma, who she felt had a different sort of freedom than she had. She tries to make her way into [[Celica]]'s group, but suffers from insecurity about her own ability to draw people to her.

Despite having to sneak into game centers to play IIDX, Tsugaru has managed to make faster progress than Daruma. She dislikes Zilch, with his weird hairdo, and Duel's strange way of speaking.

title: futatsuiwa_mamizou
body:
The "[[Tanuki]] Youkai with Ten Transformations". 

Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Ten Desires]][/i]. She's also the semi-final boss (and a playable character) in [i][[Hopeless Masquerade]][/i] and a playable character in [i][[Urban Legend in Limbo]][/i].

She is modeled after "Danzaburou Danuki":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danzaburou-danuki of "Sado Island":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sado,_Niigata], one of the three most famous [[tanuki]] alongside "Hage Danuki":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yashima_no_Hage-tanuki of "Yashima":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yashima,_Kagawa and "Shibaemon Tanuki":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shibaemon-tanuki of "Awaji Island.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Awaji_Island 

As Mamizou's official profile states that she dislikes foxes, she is considered an enemy of [[Yakumo Ran]]. However, she is good friends with [[Houjuu Nue]].

Her special skill is to disguise a thing's appearance, and she can also disguise her own. She uses a [[futatsuiwa_mamizou_(human)|human disguise]] in [[Forbidden Scrollery]].

In [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]], [spoiler]she accidentally got recruited into Gouyoku Alliance by [[Toutetsu Yuuma]].[/spoiler]

title: the_grim_reaper_who_reaped_my_heart
body:
Visual novel created by the artist and animator [[Kamuo]].

It tells the history of a young man, who one day notices how without apparent explanation, a black door appears in his room. Seeking for answers, he enters to the other side of the door, finding a cute girl who claims to be a grim reaper, and she apparently came to collect his soul. Accepting his fate, the protagonist is ready to leave this world, but he has a request for her before leaving his life behind.

The game also includes a swimsuit version. This version is virtually the same, with the only difference being the fact the girls in the game are wearing swimsuits, as the title suggests.

title: firefly_(tv_series)
body:
[b]Firefly[/b] was a 2002 American space Western drama television series, created by Joss Whedon, who previously created [[Buffy the Vampire Slayer]].

Set in the year 2517, humans have left Earth and settled in other planets in another star system. The series follow the crew of the spaceship Serenity, a Firefly-class ship, and their adventures throughout the star system. 

The series was cancelled after 14 episodes. Due to Firefly's popularity with fans and strong DVD sales, a 2005 movie, [I]Serenity[/i], was released as a proper finale for the series.

title: dexter_(tv_series)
body:
An American television crime drama mystery series that aired on Showtime from October 1, 2006, to September 22, 2013. Set in Miami, the series centers on [[Dexter Morgan]] (Michael C. Hall), a forensic technician specializing in blood spatter pattern analysis for the fictional Miami Metro Police Department, who leads a secret parallel life as a vigilante serial killer, hunting down murderers who have slipped through the cracks of the justice system. The show's first season was derived from the novel Darkly Dreaming Dexter (2004), the first of the Dexter series novels by Jeff Lindsay. It was adapted for television by screenwriter James Manos, Jr., who wrote the first episode. Subsequent seasons evolved independently of Lindsay's works.

(Source: Wikipedia)

title: frederic_chopin
body:
A Polish composer and virtuoso pianist of French-Polish parentage. He is considered one of the great masters of Romantic music. Chopin was born in Żelazowa Wola, a village in the Duchy of Warsaw. A renowned child-prodigy pianist and composer, Chopin grew up in Warsaw and completed his music education there; he composed many mature works in Warsaw before leaving Poland in 1830 at age 20, shortly before the November 1830 Uprising.

Following the Russian suppression of the Uprising, he settled in Paris as part of Poland's Great Emigration. During the remaining 19 years of his life, Chopin gave only some 30 public performances, preferring the more intimate atmosphere of the salon; he supported himself by sales of his compositions and as a piano teacher. After some romantic dalliances with Polish women, including an abortive engagement, from 1837 to 1847 he carried on a relationship with the French writer Amantine Dupin. For most of his life, Chopin suffered from poor health; he died in Paris in 1849 at age 39.
 
The vast majority of Chopin's works are for solo piano, though he also wrote two piano concertos, a few chamber pieces and some songs to Polish texts. His piano works are often technically demanding, with an emphasis on nuance and expressive depth. Chopin invented the instrumental ballade and made major innovations to the piano sonata, mazurka, waltz, nocturne, polonaise, étude, impromptu, scherzo and prélude.

h4. See also

* [[Frederic Chopin (Trusty Bell)]]
other_names: フレデリック・ショパン

title: frederic_chopin_(trusty_bell)
body:
[[Trusty Bell]] (Eternal Sonata) incarnation of the famous composer.

The game has him dream of meeting Polka, young girl with an incurable illness, who is the same age his younger sister Emilia was when she died of tuberculosis. Chopin adventures with his companions in search of answers in a world which is slowly becoming his new reality. Being the anti-hero he is, Chopin serves as the final boss of the game, claiming that they were nothing but the imagination that he created. During the ending, Chopin revealed that he hoped to be defeated by his friends, as to free them from being his dream and to end his own destiny, allowing him to finally die. On a special note in another [[Bandai Namco]] game, [[Tales of Vesperia]], Frederic's costume is an alternate outfit for [[Flynn Scifo]].

body:
A [[tattoo]] located on or just above the pubic area.

A popular variant typically worn by females is a tattoo resembling a heart-shape, which (if magical) usually has the effect of increasing the wearer's libido and/or fertility. In many cases it is also evocative of (and positioned over) the [[uterus]]. Sometimes used as a "mark" that person belongs to someone.

A famed example is [[Olga Discordia]], whose primary sex scene revolved around the gradual breakdown of a womb-protection spell, as indicated by such a tattoo.

title: ks-23
body:
The [b]KS-23[/b] (Russian: Карабин специальный, 23 мм (Special Carbine, 23 mm)) is a Soviet [[pump action]] [[shotgun]] that fires 23×75mmR [[ammunition|cartridge]], which is equal to 6.27 gauge using the British and American standards of [[shotgun shell|shotgun gauges]] and approximately 4 gauge using the current European standards. It was designed in the 1970s for suppressing [[prison]] [[rioting|riots]]. The KS-23 began to see use during the mid-1980s by several MVD forces.

The shotgun is commonly available in two variants: Traditional wooden fixed stock and pistol gripped with side-[[folding stock]]. 

h1. See also
* [[KS-23 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: cicada-chan_(harumina_mau)
body:
[[original|Original character]] created by the artist [[Harumina Mau]]

She is one of the main characters in a comics saga which represents multiple [[arthropod girl|arthropod girls]].

She is a [[mini person|little]] cicada girl, living free in the nature. Curiously, her first appearance in the saga appeals to the process of real-life cicadas to reach adulthood, digging and emerging from the underground, and shedding their skin. [i](See post #6437116).[/i]

She has [[translucent hair|translucent]] [[two-tone_hair|two-tone]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[absurdly long hair]], colored [[brown hair|brown]] and [[white hair|white]] respectively, adorned with a pair of [[hair bobbles|bobbles]], tiny [[antennae|antennas]], and [[gradient eyes]]. Her attire consists in a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[brown dress|brown]] [[layered dress]] with [[spaghetti strap|thin straps]], [[brown gloves|brown]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[fingerless gloves|gloves]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[sandals]]. The tag [[bare legs]] is also applicable for her appearance. The artist always portraits her as a [[chibi]].

title: satsuki_rin
body:
A [[Touhou]] character speculated to have once been intended as playable in [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]], but she was cut before the game's release. A few minor references in the source code of the game are all that's left of her. It's believed she was intended to be a kirin.

Originally thought to be the girl in ZUN's [[circle cut]] for [i]Embodiment of Scarlet Devil[/i] until it was revealed to just be a random poster girl for Team Shanghai Alice. Unfortunately, nearly all fan depictions of her have used this design, thinking it was Rin.

Well before [[Ten Desires]] was announced, two popular rumors in the fandom was that she was a Taoist, due to the [[erhu]], and a nurse like [[Yagokoro Eirin]] ("kirin" in Japanese is often associated with white mages). Coincidence?

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Rin Satsuki":[http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Rin_Satsuki]

title: siobhan_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Siobhan is an NPC on Penacony. Upon completing all Adventure Missions of the Vignettes in a Cup Event, she can be found in Dreamjolt Hostelry in The Reverie (Dreamscape).

h4. Appearance

Siobhan has [[short_hair|short]] [[blonde_hair|blonde]] hair with an [[asymmetrical_hair |asymmetric]] cut, longer on the right. Her left ear wears a [[gold_earrings|golden earring]]. Her pupils are greenish [[blue_pupils|blue]].

She wears masculine outfits: a [[red_jacket|red jacket]] with a [[black_belt|black belt]] on the right sleeve, a [[blue_shirt|dark-blue]] flower-patterned outer shirt, an even darker inner shirt, [[black_wristband|black bands]] on her right wrist, a [[purple_necktie|purple]] [[plaid_necktie|plaid necktie]], a [[black_choker|black choker]], a golden flower-shaped [[necklace|necklace]], [[grey_pants|gray trousers]] with a [[purple_rope|purple rope]] on the right, and [[brown_footwear|brown shoes]]. Her outer shirt hangs a pair of [[sunglasses|sunglasses]].

title: kamishibai
body:
[b]Kamishibai[/b] (lit. "Paper theatre") is a form of Japanese entertainment medium that became popular during the early 20th century, though it suffered a decline after the widespread introduction of movies and television after World War II.

Essentially a primitive form of motion pictures, kamishibai involves the narrator who told the story through describing the scene depicted on a paper sheet contained inside the box, switch the sheet as the story progress, and often voiced the characters all by themselves.

title: batman_v_superman:_dawn_of_justice
body:
Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice is a 2016 American superhero film based on the DC Comics characters Batman and Superman. Produced by Warner Bros. Pictures, it is a follow-up to the 2013 film [[Man of Steel]] and the second film in the [[DC Extended Universe]] (DCEU). The film was directed by [[Zack Snyder]], written by Chris Terrio and David S. Goyer, and features an ensemble cast that includes [[Ben Affleck]] as Batman and Henry Cavill as Superman. 

Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice is the first live-action film to feature Batman and Superman together, as well as the first live-action cinematic portrayal of [[Wonder Woman]]. In the film, criminal mastermind [[Lex Luthor]] manipulates Batman into a preemptive battle with Superman, who Luthor is obsessed with destroying.

title: zack_snyder
body: Zachary Edward Snyder (born March 1, 1966) is an American film director, producer, and screenwriter. He made his feature film debut in 2004 with Dawn of the Dead, a remake of the 1978 horror film of the same name. Since then, he has directed or produced a number of comic book and superhero films, including 300 (2006) and Watchmen (2009), as well as the Superman film that started the [[DC Extended Universe]], [[Man of Steel]] (2013), and its follow-ups, [[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice]] (2016) and Justice League (2017), as well as the director's cut of Justice League that was later released in 2021.

title: watchmen
body:
A superhero comic book series written by Alan Moore and published by [[DC Comics]] in 1986. It depicts an alternate history where masked heroes emerged in the 1940s, changing many key moments in history, but became outlawed in the 1970s. The comic takes place in the 1980s as the world edges closer to [[World War III]]. The comic is notable in that, with the exception of [[Dr. Manhattan|one character]], all the masked heroes and villains are humans with no supernatural abilities.

A feature film directed by [[Zack Snyder]] was released in 2009.

h4. Characters

title: rally_car
body:
A type of [[racecar]] specifically designed for off-road Rally courses. Usually heavily modified versions of everyday cars.

The top series for Rally racing is the [[World Rally Championship]], though regional series such as the [[Japanese Rally Championship]] exist throughout the world. To this day, the Group B class Rally cars from the 1980s remain some of the most recognizable examples of rally cars.

h4. Examples
* !post #6546097: Group B [[Audi Quattro]]
* !post #6665688: Group B [[Peugeot 205]]
* !post #6688698: Rally1 [[Toyota GR Yaris]]
* !post #6546118: World Rally Car [[Citroen DS3]]

title: metal_band_text
body:
Text designed to look like the logo of a [[heavy metal]] band, most often in the style of ones used by [[black metal]] or death metal bands. Common features include excessive jagged edges and intricate lines that fold in on themselves; occasionally they also feature near-illegibility. 

Many real-world logos are either illustrated by or based on the work of Belgian calligrapher [b]Christophe Szpajdel[/b], who defined the general style.

h4. Examples
* !post #7075038 
* !post #5877603: [[metal band text]] on top, [[blackletter]] on bottom

h4. See also
* [[blackletter]], another common font choice for metal band logos
* [[tag group:text]]

* "Christoph Szpajdel (Wikipedia)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christophe_Szpajdel]

body: Range Rover is a 4x4 [[sports utility vehicle|SUV]] produced by [[Land Rover]]. The Range Rover line was launched in 1970 by British Leyland. body:
Necks in anime are usually "proportional to the overall body":[/media_assets/13418660] of the character, or sometimes unusually smaller. This is especially true for female characters, probably because thick necks are considered a more masculine trait that older and more [[muscular]] men have. 

Sometimes thick necks are also used for comedic purposes, like with [[Tanigaki genjirou]] from [[Golden Kamuy]].
Or simply as a character design choice. This is especially common in [[One piece]].

body:
The "entity" behind the direction of the first season of the web series [b]Oshare ni Naritai! Peanuts-kun[/b] (オシャレになりたい！ピーナッツくん, I want to be Trendy! Peanuts-kun), before disappearing for subsequent seasons. No one knows whether it was a company, or a doujin group, or what have you, but the leading creative behind the series, [[Anipoko]] (兄ぽこ) had been a member of it, and even wrote on MODE AIM's blog, while their email remains in use for both Peanuts-kun's and Ponpoko's YouTube channels to this day.

"Kouga-ryuu":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C5%8Dga-ry%C5%AB Ninja Ponpoko, first appearing as a character in Peanuts-kun, became a [[virtual YouTuber]] in 2018, with Peanuts-kun joining her soon after.

title: ncr_veteran_ranger
body: They are elite Rangers in the [[NCR]] Army. They wear the iconic NCR Ranger combat [[armor]], commonly referred to as "Black Armor", [[coat]], and the distinctive [[helmet]] inspired in [[jin-roh|Jin-Roh: The Wolf Brigade]]. They are renowned for their survival and combat prowess. They often perform reconnaissance, so they use [[sniper rifle]] during operations.

title: protect_gear
body:
The iconic [[power armor|power armour]] seen in the [[Kerberos Saga]], most notably the 1999 anime film [[Jin-Roh|Jin-Roh: The Wolf Brigade]]. 

Developed by the [[nazi|Germans]] during [[World War II]] (in the series' [[alternate universe|alternate timeline]]), it consists of a set of mostly-conventional looking metal [[body armor|body armour]], with a [[Stahlhelm]] and a [[gas mask]] with [[breathing tube|respirator tubes]] and [[glowing eyes|glowing red eyes]], and a metal [[backpack]] with two [[radio antenna|antennas]].  The [b]protect gear[/b] is used by personnel of the Japanese Capital Police Special Unit "Kerberos" (also known as "Panzer Cops"), who are [[weapon|armed]] with [[MG42]] [[machine gun|machine guns]] (originally [[MG34]]'s in [[akai megane|The Red Spectacles]]). 

The design is clearly inspired by the soldiers of [[nazi|Nazi Germany]] during [[World War II]] (as well as the [i]Stormtroopers[/i] of [[german empire|Imperial Germany]] in [[World War I]]), and has influenced quite a lot of fictional soldier designs, such as [[Killzone]], [[ncr veteran ranger|Fallout]], [[wolfenstein (series)|Wolfenstein]], and even "Scooby-doo":[https://scoobydoo.fandom.com/wiki/Kriegstaffebot].

h1. See also
* [[List of armor|List of Armour]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

body:
A [[meme]] where one person tells another that they were visiting their friend and the other interrupts with "Bro visited his friend" in a mocking tone.

The artist of the original comic explained "I made up this bit for VCs where when someone says something you just repeat what they said verbatim but put 'bro/bro's' at the start of it. The more mundane the action the funnier it is."

!asset #20614301: Original comic by "fallenchungus":https://twitter.com/fallenchungus

title: bereal
body:
BeReal (stylized as BeReal.) is a French messaging app released in 2020, developed by Alexis Barreyat and Kévin Perreau. Its main feature is a daily notification that encourages users to share photos with friends of themselves and their day to day life given a randomly selected two-minute window every day. Critics noted its emphasis on authenticity, which some felt crossed the line into the mundane. The name "BeReal" is a pun. Its primary reference relates to its focus on users uploading unpolished photos, while also being a pun of the term b-reel.

h4. See also

* [[Fan Screaming at Madison Beer (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: BeReal":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BeReal

title: kawasaki_t-4
body:
Subsonic [[jet]] trainer in use by the [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]]. It seats a crew of two in tandem, has shallowly-swept wings with small mid-span sawtooth leading edges, "tricycle landing gear":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tricycle_gear, and is powered by two turbofans exhausting under the all-moving tailplanes. It bears a resemblance to the Franco-German "Alpha Jet":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dassault_Breguet_Dornier_Alpha_Jet, but its widely spaced engines give it a beefier appearance. Two underwing hardpoints enable it to carry bombs, rockets, and a special air-sampling pod developed by Kawasaki.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Kawasaki T-4":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawasaki_T-4
* Airliners.net: "Kawasaki T-4 images":http://www.airliners.net/search/photo.search?aircraft_genericsearch=Kawasaki%20T-4
* Youtube: "T-4 in action with the JASDF Blue Impulse aerobatic team":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1_fJJ9BvPVM&feature=related

title: mitsubishi_f-1
body:
Single-seat "close air support":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Close_air_support and maritime strike fighter used by the JASDF. Developed from Mitsubishi's previous [[Mitsubishi t-2]] trainer, the shoulder-winged, twin-engined F-1 bears a marked resemblance to the Anglo/French "Jaguar":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SEPECAT_Jaguar. Armament includes one JM61 [[Gatling gun]] and five hardpoints capable of carrying air-to-ground and antiship ordnance, plus AIM-9 Sidewinders for self-defense.

title: f-16_fighting_falcon
body:
The [b]General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon[/b] is a multirole [[jet]] fighter aircraft originally developed by General Dynamics for the United States Air Force (USAF). 

Designed as an air superiority day fighter, it evolved into a successful all-weather multirole aircraft. Over 4,500 aircraft have been built since production was approved in 1976. Although no longer being purchased by the U.S. Air Force, improved versions are still being built for export customers. 

In 1993, General Dynamics sold its aircraft manufacturing business to the Lockheed Corporation, which in turn became part of Lockheed Martin after a 1995 merger with Martin Marietta.

The Fighting Falcon is a fighter with numerous innovations including a frameless bubble canopy for better visibility, side-mounted control stick to ease control while maneuvering, a seat reclined 30 degrees to reduce the effect of g-forces on the pilot, and the first use of a relaxed static stability/fly-by-wire flight control system that makes it a highly nimble aircraft. 

The F-16 has an internal M61 Vulcan cannon and 11 locations for mounting weapons and other mission equipment. The F-16's official name is "Fighting Falcon", but "Viper" is commonly used by its pilots, due to a perceived resemblance to a viper snake as well as the [[Battlestar Galactica]] [[viper_(spacecraft)|Colonial Viper]] starfighter.

In addition to active duty U.S. Air Force, Air Force Reserve Command, and Air National Guard units, the aircraft is also used by the USAF aerial demonstration team, the U.S. Air Force Thunderbirds, and as an adversary/aggressor aircraft by the United States Navy. The F-16 has also been procured to serve in the air forces of 25 other nations. It served as the basis for the development of the Mitsubishi [[Mitsubishi f-2]] jet fighter from [[Japan]].

h4.See Also

* [[List of Airplanes]]

title: mitsubishi_asm-1
body:
Type 80 Air-to-Ship Missile is an air-launched Air-to-ship [[missile]] developed by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries. It entered service with the [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]] in 1980.

The major launch platforms for the Type 80 are the [[Mitsubishi f-1|Mitsubishi F-1]], JASDF F-4EJ Kai and [[Mitsubishi f-2|Mitsubishi F-2]].

title: mitsubishi_asm-3
body:
The ASM-3 is an supersonic anti-ship [[missile]] being developed by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries to replace the [[mitsubishi_asm-1|ASM-1]] and [[mitsubishi_asm-2|ASM-2]] missiles. The major launch platform is the [[Mitsubishi f-2|Mitsubishi F-2]]. 

Planned Initial Operational Capability was 2016. The [[missile]] will be used by the [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]].

title: mitsubishi_f-2
body:
The Mitsubishi F-2 is a multirole fighter derived from the General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon, and manufactured by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries and Lockheed Martin for the [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]], with a 60/40 split in manufacturing between [[Japan]] and the [[United states|United States]].

The basis of the F-2's design is the [[f-16_fighting_falcon|F-16]] Agile Falcon, an unsuccessful offer by General Dynamics to provide a low-cost alternative for the Advanced Tactical Fighter (ATF) competition. 

Production started in 1996 and the first [[aircraft]] entered service in 2000. The first 76 aircraft entered service by 2008, with a total of 98 airframes produced. The first active electronically scanned array (AESA) radar on a combat aircraft was the J/APG-1 introduced on the Mitsubishi F-2 in 1995.

The F-2 is nicknamed "Viper Zero", a reference to the [[f-16_fighting_falcon|F-16]]'s unofficial nickname of "Viper" and the [[A6M Zero|Mitsubishi A6M Zero]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mitsubishi F-2":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_F-2]

title: leaf_censor
body:
Usually crotch or nipples censored by a single leaf.

Has been used as a form of censorship method in anime and other media.

See also: 
* [[fig leaf]], the most common type of leaf used in this context.
